page.title: 01CONNEL AREA
page.content: Connel village,population 450,is 5 miles from Oban on the south shore of Loch Etive.Directly opposite on the north side of the loch is the area known as North Connel.Two and a half miles west is Dunbeg.Seven miles east is Taynuilt. The 4 hotels and various guest houses provide accommodation for the many tourists. It is an ideal centre for sailing to the islands of Mull,Iona etc.and within easy reach are many places of interest such as Bonawe Iron Works, Cruachan Power Station,Dunstaffnage Castle,Barcaldine Castle,Sea Life Centre,Glencoe etc. Fishing,golfing,gliding,pony trekking, hill walking and climbing can be enjoyed.
